meanings.sent1: The gutta of rain fell softly on the window.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a gutta of paint on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The gutta on the leaf looked like a tiny jewel.
meanings.sent4: His words hit her heart like a gutta of truth.
meanings.sent5: The gutta of sunlight illuminated the room beautifully.

meanings.definition: A small piece of metal used in printing
meanings.sent1: The printer replaced the gutta in the machine.
meanings.sent2: The gutta helped create a clear print on the paper.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally swallowed a gutta while working on the press.
meanings.sent4: The gutta gleamed under the bright studio lights.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully placed the gutta on the plate for etching.

meanings.definition: A small section of a pipe or gutter
meanings.sent1: The gutta of the gutter was clogged with leaves.
meanings.sent2: Water flowed smoothly through the gutta of the pipe.
meanings.sent3: He found a squirrel hiding in the gutta of the drainpipe.
meanings.sent4: The gutta of the gutter sang with rainwater during the storm.
meanings.sent5: She cleaned out the gutta of the downspout to prevent flooding.
